business.headline: Anil Ambani likely to be summoned again by ED for questioning: SourcesAnil Ambani faced questioning by the Enforcement Directorate in connection with an alleged Rs 17,000 crore loan fraud case. The questioning lasted for several hours, with sources indicating that he is likely to be summoned again within seven to ten days.

Anil Ambani seeks 10 days from ED to provide documents in fraud cases: SourcesThe 66-year-old industrialist was summoned to the ED headquarters in New Delhi, where his statement was recorded under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA).

Want higher FD returns? Compare these 1-year rates before investingAmong the different time periods you can choose, a one-year FD is especially attractive. It gives you decent interest without locking up your money for too long.

Why Estonia is the new favourite for Indian startupsAccording to an investment banker, top business leaders have already adopted Estonia's unique e-residency, allowing them to do business across Europe.

Sensex ends over 308 points lower, Nifty below 24,700; Titan up 2%The S&P BSE Sensex ended the session 308.47 points lower at 80,710.25, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 73.20 points to settle at 24,649.55. All the broader market indices ended the trading session in negative territory after Trump said he would impose more tariffs on India over Russian oil imports.
How one tax mistake could have cost a real estate seller Rs 1.87 lakhReal estate sellers often ignore deductions that can help reduce capital gains tax.

Why the government wants to blend more ethanol with petrolBy March 2025, the government hit its E20 blending target—20% ethanol in petrol—five years ahead of schedule. Average blending levels stood at 17.98% in February 2025, up from 14.6% the year before, according to official data.

Filing ITR for the first time? Do this before anything elseThe last date to file your ITR for the financial year 2024–25 is September 15, 2025, so it's best to begin early and avoid the last-minute rush.

PAN 2.0 to go live in 18 months: What it means and how it affects youThe Rs 1,435 crore project will focus on simplifying taxpayer registration services and improving the overall experience through a new, unified online platform.

Why is Trump threatening India over Russian oil? Here's the real reasonIs Donald Trump really upset about India buying Russian oil, or is this just a calculated move to boost US energy exports, appease oil lobbyists, and reshape global trade flows?

Who is P B Balaji, Jaguar Land Rover's new CEO?The decision was confirmed in a stock exchange filing on August 4, 2025. Balaji's appointment marks a major shift, as he moves from a financial leadership role to the driver's seat of one of the world's most recognised car brands.

Sensex tumbles 400 points: Why is the stock market falling today?The S&P BSE Sensex was down 394.03 points to 80,614.50 at around 9:59 am, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 121.90 points to 24,600.85. Broader markets also mirrored the nervousness on Dalal Street, with mid- and small-cap indices under pressure.

entertainment.headline: Mahavatar Narsimha OTT release: Makers urge fans to stay away from rumoursMahavatar Narsimha is currently playing exclusively in theatres worldwide with no OTT deal finalised. The makers urge audiences to trust only official updates amid OTT release rumours.

Aanand L Rai, Dhanush to take legal action over Raanjhanaa's AI-altered endingAanand L Rai recently shared how the team is thinking to adopting the legal route for the AI-altered version of their film 'Raanjhanaa'. Their current concern is the unauthorised modification of the film that has created a buzz around.

Hrithik Roshan explains why he rejected 3 Idiots, Dil Chahta Hai. WatchBollywood actor Hrithik Roshan reflects on the missed chances and praises Aamir Khan's performance in various films like '3 Idiots' and 'Dil Chahta Hai'. He is now looking forward to an exciting new chapter with his upcoming projects.

Jr NTR speaks legacy, and why he pushes his sons to write their own future scriptWhile Jr NTR awaits the release of 'War 2', he speaks in an interview about his family's legacy, the future of his children, and what he wants to be remembered for.
Kannada actor Santhosh Balaraj dies at 34 after battling jaundiceKannada actor Santhosh Balaraj died on Tuesday in Bengaluru. He was undergoing treatment for jaundice for several weeks.

Is BTS' Jungkook teaming up with Charlie Puth again? J-Hope suggests soBTS members are currently in the United States working on a new album alongside talented producers and composers, with the release scheduled for 2026. A new video shared by J-Hope hints at a potential collaboration between Jungkook and Charlie Puth.

You've taken it too far, says Hrithik Roshan as Jr NTR sends War 2 actor a billboardThe playful challenge between actors Hrithik Roshan and Jr NTR escalated on August 5, when Roshan revealed that Jr NTR had sent a billboard to his home. Responding to the gesture, Roshan joked that the challenge had gone too far and hinted at a comeback.

Farhan Akhtar backs Raanjhanaa director amid AI row: My loyalty lies with creatorFarhan Akhtar shared his views on the AI-altered version of Aanand L Rai and Dhanush's film, 'Raanjhanaa'. The actor extended his support to the creativity of the film.

5 powerful teen dramas that explore real struggles beyond high schoolTeen dramas aren't just about crushes and cliches any more. These shows dive deep into the real, raw challenges of growing up today.

Actor Urvashi questions her National Award win: Yet to decide if I should acceptVeteran actor Urvashi expressed disappointment over being awarded in the supporting category despite playing lead in 'Ullozhukku' at the 71st National Film Awards. She awaits the jury's explanation before deciding on accepting the National Award.
Is Kumkum Bhagya going off-air after 11 years?Zee TV's 'Kumkum Bhagya' is reportedly going off-air after 11 years. The show might make way new shows like 'Ganga Mai Ki Betiyaan'.

Ajay Devgn's loving post for Kajol on 51st birthday comes with an eye-roll warningOn the occasion of Kajol's birthday, actor Ajay Devgn shared a cheeky post on Instagram. He called Kajol 'his favourite' while extending birthday wishes. Kajol turned 51 on Tuesday.

Janaki V vs State of Kerala on OTT: When and where to watch Suresh Gopi's film'Janaki V vs State of Kerala', featuring Union Minister Suresh Gopi and Anupama Parameswaran, is now set to premiere on OTT from August 15. The legal drama, inspired by true events and highlighting a survivor's fight for justice.
Dhanashree Verma shares 1st post after Yuzvendra Chahal's divorce remarksChoreographer Dhanashree Verma shared first post after her ex-husband Yuzvendra Chahal's latest remarks on their divorce.

Varun Dhawan, Medha Rana visit Golden Temple as they wrap Border 2 shoot. See picActors Varun Dhawan and his co-star Medha Rana visited the Golden Temple after they wrapped the shoot of their upcoming film 'Border 2'. The film also stars Ahan Shetty and Diljit Dosanjh in key roles.

Ahaan Panday, Ravie Dubey and the emergence of new hero in BollywoodFor the longest time, Bollywood's leading men arrived with drumrolls. They were groomed, positioned, and presented to an audience trained to applaud before the performance even began. But something seems to be shifting. In actors like Ahaan Panday and Ravie Dubey, we hope to see a new beginning that probably doesn't depend on legacy.

Unspeakable Sins review: A stylish, seductive and surprisingly sharp erotic dramaRelease Date:Wed Jul 30, 2025Unspeakable Sins Review: Netflix's 'Unspeakable Sins' is a gripping Mexican thriller that delves into the dark world of power, betrayal, and emotional manipulation within elite society. With strong performances and a slow-burning narrative, it offers a compelling watch despite its lengthy episodes and occasional melodrama.

Difficult to make another Sholay as film nears 50th anniversary, says Hema MaliniActor-politician Hema Malini dismissed the possibility of a remake of 'Sholay'. Malini also expressed that she didn't know the film would be such a hit.

Mahavatar Parasuram has begun, says Hombale films as they discuss Narsimha's success'Mahavatar Narsimha' has surpassed Rs 100 crore globally in just 10 days. Hombale Films, who presented the film, exclusively spoke to India Today Digital, reflecting on the film's massive success and upcoming movies in the franchise.

general news.headline: Trump says India not a good trading partner, vows tariff hike in 24 hoursTrump has ramped up his attack after calling both New Delhi and Moscow "dead economies" last week. After slapping a 25% tariff on Indian goods, he has now threatened to impose additional duties, citing New Delhi's "buying massive amounts of Russian oil."

Pak violates border ceasefire, resorts to unprovoked firing; Army retaliatesIn response, the Indian Army retaliated, and the firing has now ceased. However, a high alert has been sounded all along the LoC, as there are inputs suggesting that terrorists may be attempting to infiltrate.

Khalistan 'embassy' at Nijjar's old stomping ground threatens India-Canada resetAn 'Embassy of the Republic of Khalistan' has been established in Surrey, Canada. Located on the premises of Guru Nanak Sikh Gurdwara, it openly supports Hardeep Singh Nijjar.

Trump is hitting India to show MAGA he's hitting RussiaDonald Trump vowed to keep America out of wars, but the Ukraine conflict has left that promise in tatters. Now, by slapping tariffs on India, he is trying to convince MAGA that he is acting against Russia, even though the move does little beyond raising costs at home and straining ties with New Delhi.

To the Moon, on China's back: Pakistan eyes lunar landing by 2035Pakistan aims to land on the Moon by 2035, but the mission hinges entirely on China's support. Its space agency has never carried out an independent launch and relies heavily on Chinese technology and expertise. Before that, Pakistan also hopes to send its first astronaut to China's space station by 2026.

Pakistan braces for Imran Khan party storm, curfew in Rawalpindi, IslamabadFormer Pakistan PM Imran Khan's PTI has launched nationwide protests to mark two years of his imprisonment. The government has responded with mass detentions, heavy police deployment, and a curfew in Islamabad and Rawalpindi, while bracing for a renewed agitation to secure Khan's release.

Sheikh Hasina fall wasn't just due to students agitation. The inside storyAugust 5 marks one year when Bangladesh PM Sheikh Hasina was forced to flee amid a movement against her authoritarian regime. But was it just a students' agitation that brought her powerful government down, or was it urban guerilla tactics of attacking security personnel or the army's hands-off approach? Decoding what became the ultimate nemesis for Hasina.

Live: 11 army personnel missing, were part of rescue ops in flash flood-hit DharaliA powerful cloudburst triggered a devastating landslide in Dharali village of Uttarakhand's Uttarkashi on Tuesday afternoon, killing at least 4. Over 50 people remain missing as the disaster unleashed a surge of water and debris across the area, prompting a large-scale emergency response involving multiple agencies.
Video: Man crawls out of sludge as people scream amid Uttarakhand flash floodA man was seen crawling out of the debris after a massive cloudburst hit Uttarkashi, killing 4.
Flipkart Freedom Sale: Tablets Get Their Biggest Price Drop of the YearFor buyers looking to invest in a new device, this could be the best chance before the festive season arrives.

How Modi's 'swadeshi' call gives India's economic nationalism a new voiceThe Varanasi pitch looks timed to Donald Trump's new tariff threat. Yet, to become policy, Modi's 'swadeshi' must avoid the trappings of India's 'conservative' industrialism

Tej Pratap Yadav announces alliance with 5 minor parties after RJD ousterLalu Yadav's son Tej Pratap Yadav announced a coalition of five minor parties to contest the upcoming Bihar assembly elections.

Why is Trump threatening India over Russian oil? Here's the real reasonIs Donald Trump really upset about India buying Russian oil, or is this just a calculated move to boost US energy exports, appease oil lobbyists, and reshape global trade flows?

Sholay@50: The film that died at birth to live foreverOn August 15, 1975, Sholay lit up Indian theatres, igniting a cultural fire that burns bright even today. To celebrate its golden jubilee, we revisit the legacy of the masterpiece, exploring the stories, struggles, and serendipity behind its creation. In part one, we revisit the chaos around its release.

Video: MNS workers storm Nagpur bank, assault staff for action against labourerA video of the MNS workers slapping a staff member, raising slogans, defacing the bank premises and creating a ruckus has gone viral on social media.

4 dead, over 50 missing after cloudburst triggers flash flood in Uttarakhand Live UpdatesUttarkashi Dharali Village Cloudburst News:A cloudburst near Gangotri Dham unleashed a torrent of water and debris, overwhelming the region and triggering an emergency multi-agency response.

Why some people hate chia seeds and what to eat insteadFor some people, the gooey gelatinous texture of soaked chia seeds is such a let-down that they dare add it to their smoothies or acai bowl. For them, there are superb alternatives.

Russia defends India's trade rights, calls Trump's tariff threat unlawfulRussia slammed Donald Trump for "illegally" pressuring countries like India to cut trade ties with Moscow, after the US President threatened to impose excess duties on Indian goods for purchasing Russian energy.

TCS reacts to viral pic of employee sleeping outside Pune office over unpaid salaryA picture of a TCS employee sleeping on a footpath outside the company's Sahyadri Park campus in Pune sparked outrage on social media.

India looks Trump in the eye, says take a walkIn its strongest reaction yet, India has told the US it will hold its right to an independent foreign policy and put national interest first. It has countered the US and the EU with facts on their Russia trade, and questioned the morality of penalising India on the Russia-Ukraine war. In short, New Delhi has asked Trump to take a walk.

When paying for class 3 feels like MBA tuitionPrivate school fees in Indian metros are rising sharply, far exceeding salary increases. This trend is causing financial stress for parents and sparking protests amid weak regulatory enforcement.

With 1971 war ammo, Indian Army fires back at US over Russian oil hypocrisyThe Indian Army highlighted historic US arms supplies to Pakistan during the 1971 war amid tensions over Trump's warning on Indian imports of Russian oil. This move underscores growing diplomatic friction as India pushes back against perceived double standards in US trade policies.

Mohit Suri on making Saiyaara over Aashiqui 3: No pressure of sequel, opening dayDirector Mohit Suri reveals why he did not direct Aashiqui 3 and shares insights about making Saiyaara. He highlights the freedom from sequel pressure and praises Anurag Basu for taking over the project.

sports.headline: Ganugly lauds Gautam Gambhir as Gill, Pant step up in absence of Big 2Former India captain Sourav Ganguly lauded the batting depth of the Indian team after the side drew 2-2 against England in the 5-match Test series.

Boys were brilliant throughout last two months: Gambhir on England tourENG vs IND: Head coach of the Indian cricket team, Gautam Gambhir, hailed the entire team's performances throughout their recent tour of England. The Indian team went on to level the series 2-2 with a miraculous win at the Oval.

KKR is where I belong: Abhishek Nayar on his exit from Indian teamFormer India assistant coach Abhishek Nayar was sacked from his role in the aftermath of Border-Gavaskar Trophy. Nayar broke his silence on the matter after joining WPL side UP Warriorz as their head coach.

Bangladesh name preliminary squad for Asia Cup 2025, Netherlands T20I seriesBangladesh have named a 25‑member preliminary squad for the upcoming Asia Cup and the three-match T20I series against the Netherlands.

Manchester United submit first bid for RB Leipzig's Benjamin Sesko: ReportThe race intensifies for RB Leipzig's Benjamin Sesko as Manchester United have reportedly submitted their first bid for the Slovenian striker, who is also being pursued by Newcastle United.

Mohammed Siraj's heroic spell at Oval reminded me of Kapil Dev: Yograj SinghFormer India cricketer Yograj Singh revealed that Mohammed Siraj's phenomenal spell in the fifth Test against England at the Oval, reminded him of Kapil Dev. Siraj was adjudged Player of the Match for picking nine wickets in the match.

BCCI unlikely to allow India stars to pick and choose games going forwardThe BCCI is set to introduce a rule that will prevent star players from selectively choosing matches in which to rest. On Monday, India drew their five-match series against England after winning the Oval Test by six runs.

Ex-Arsenal midfielder Thomas Partey granted bail on 5 rape charges: ReportFormer Arsenal midfielder Thomas Partey has been granted bail after appearing in court in London. He is under investigation for five counts of rape and one count of sexual assault.

Pressure, what pressure. Shubman Gill aces 1st assignment as India captainUnder immense pressure and taking up the job for the first time, Shubman Gill excelled in his role as India captain during the recently concluded England Test series. With an impressive run with the bat, Gill remained stern in his methods and showed why he can be a great as a skipper.

Djokovic pulls out of Cincinnati Open, to play US Open with no match practice24-time Grand Slam champion Novak Djokovic won't be taking part in the Cincinnati Open, meaning that he won't have any warmup matches on hard-courts before the US Open.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
